cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 35 mi (55 km) W of Cancún, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the southern Gulf of Mexico, then turning north toward the Louisiana coast while remaining well east of the Texas Coastal Bend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Louisiana coast (near Morgan City/Cameron area)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greatest impacts expected from upper Texas coast eastward across Louisiana, Mississippi and Alabama coasts
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤6%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions with occasional gusts possible if Delta tracks farther west.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor water-level rises (≤1 ft) and elevated surf/rip currents possible from long-period swells.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could bring 1–2 inches of rain late Thursday into Friday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and rough Gulf seas that could disrupt offshore operations and pilot transfers.
